sen.j: 御伽衆（おとぎしゅう）とは、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代初期にかけて戦国大名家に存在した職掌。
sen.e: Otogishu is the official duties, which existed in families of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) from the Warring States Period (Japan) to the early Edo period.

sen.e: Otogishu is the official duties, which existed in families of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) from the the Sengoku period (period of Warring States) to the early Edo period.

sen.j: 主君の側に召し出されて政治や軍事の相談役となり、また武辺話や諸国の動静を伝えたり、世間話の相手も務めた側近。
sen.e: Otogishu were the close advisers who were called to their lord's side and gave advice about politics and military affair, while they also reported buhenbanashi (anecdotes about the life of samurai) or situation of various districts to their lord.

sen.e: Otogishu was also known as Ohanashi-shu (collocutor of the load), Gohobanshu (officials who accompany shogun) and the brains.

sen.j: 戦国時代は参謀としての面が強かったため、僧侶や隠居して第一線から退いた重臣、没落した大名、武将が僧形となり務めることが多かった。
sen.e: In the Warring States Period, otogishu was more likely to be a counselor, therefore, people like Buddhist monk, chief retainer who retired and withdrew to the sidelines, downfallen daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and busho (Japanese military commander) became priestly attire and served as otogishu.

sen.j: 戦乱の世が治まってからは、主君の無聊を慰める役割も重視され、豊臣秀吉の頃には、勃興した新勢力である町人らも召し出され新たな文化の担い手となった。
sen.e: After the turbulent age died down, the role of comforting lord's boredom also became to be emphasized, and townspeople who rose suddenly and became innovative power were also called to the lord's presence as otgishu and became new culture bearers at the time of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降も将軍や諸大名は御伽衆を召し抱えたが、政治の実権が重臣に移るにつれ、次第に勢力は衰えた。
sen.e: After Edo Period, shogun and territorial lords still had otogishu, however, as political power passed into the hands of chief retainers, power of otogishu had gradually weakened.
